text:
Anybody able to help with this? <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/This-hapikey-eu1-redacted-key-doesn-t-exist-Any-ideas/m-p/496317#M46901>

Unable to use the api to interact with my app at all
Is this possible to get response with more than 100 contacts?
Is there an API endpoint for *submitting* forms? (Not just creating/editing forms.)

sure thing, here are all the things the api can do.
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/forms_overview#hs_cos_wrapper_module_1417796550404975>
<@U01D95STUS3> Thanks, looks good! Reading "legacydocs" makes me a little uneasy, though :sweat_smile: Is this a somewhat stable API? Not deprecated or anything?

on every page you click you should find in the upper portion of the page a link to the updated api, this is perfectly okay to use and if and when something becomes obsolete, especially when working with api's you should watch this page for changes: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog>

so for instance the newer api for forms is still in beta, so they are actually in the process of changing the api version but not every single point can be transitioned to the new version, it's a tedious process, so they are in the transition step right now
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing/forms>
Yeah, that's the API docs I found via Google. There wasn't an endpoint for submitting form data in there :thinking_face: But I will use the legacy docs for now. Thanks for the help!

We have a client that is looking to pull in "availability" data into a HubSpot website for vacation tours from SAP via an API call. The availability data we would like to display to users would need to be requested via API and hosted on either the HubDB or on a 3rd party database such as Amazon Web Services. Based on the technical limitations (<https://legal.HubSpot.com/HubSpot-product-and-services-catalog>) it looks like we are limited to 200 requests per every 10-seconds. On a page such as this: <https://www.easytravel.co.tz/tanzania-tours/romance-and-honeymoon>, where a single user could be loading upwards of 10 tours or more simultaneously within 10 seconds, it seems like HubSpot's 200 requests may be a big limiting factor. 

Are there any potential known workarounds or a way to increase the number of allowed requests? Any help is greatly appreciated! Thanks!
